intro: Macaranga vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands, including Vanuatu and Fiji. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves with a distinctive waxy coating. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is typically found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests and is adapted to thrive in humid, nutrient-rich soils. Macaranga vitiensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various insect and bird species.
